body_html: @filipetrocadoferreira I can’t find any link with an extensive explanation (I tought it was explained in tf.cond ’s documentation but actually it is not). In short, if you don’t define the branches as functions, they will be both executed regardless of the condition. This explains why you still had the problem despite checking the tensor’s size.
body_text: @filipetrocadoferreira I can’t find any link with an extensive explanation (I tought it was explained in tf.cond ’s documentation but actually it is not). In short, if you don’t define the branches as functions, they will be both executed regardless of the condition. This explains why you still had the problem despite checking the tensor’s size.
body: @filipetrocadoferreira I can’t find any link with an extensive explanation (I tought it was explained in tf.cond ’s documentation but actually it is not). In short, if you don’t define the branches as functions, they will be both executed regardless of the condition. This explains why you still had the problem despite checking the tensor’s size.
